sense.name: lag or linger behind
sense.examples: The dog trailed some distance behind his master. John trailed behind his class mates in math. Caterpillar Inc. said full-year earnings will trail last year's results. He trailed for only five holes during his six matches.

sense.name: (cause to) lay or drag along a surface
sense.examples: The bride's veil trailed along the ground. The ivy trailed across the balcony. Two men were wounded and staggered along, trailing blood behind them. The toddler was trailing his pants. The rock trailed seaweed whiskers.

sense.name: follow a trail; pursue
sense.examples: He trailed them into the Osage Nation and located their hide-out.

sense.name: TRAIL OFF: dwindle; come to an end
sense.examples: Sales of the low-end products may finally be trailing off. His voice trailed off when he saw the look on her face.
